sinks.name: TEE_CloseAndDeletePersistentObject1
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on the persistent object handle could lead to undefined behavior or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Size parameter could lead to buffer overflow if tainted data is used.

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Data pointer could lead to writing tainted data to persistent storage.

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer could lead to freeing invalid memory, causing memory corruption or double free vulnerabilities.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be tainted, leading to memory corruption or denial of service.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Destination pointer could be tainted, leading to potential memory corruption or exposure of sensitive data.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Source pointer could be tainted, leading to potential memory corruption or exposure of sensitive data.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Potential for unencrypted data exposure to Normal World if the buffer is shared.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflow or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: strlen
sinks.reason: Missing input validation allows for potential exploitation with tainted pointers leading to undefined behavior.

sinks.name: strncmp
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer to first string could lead to out-of-bounds access

sinks.name: strncmp
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer to second string could lead to out-of-bounds access

sinks.name: strncmp
sinks.reason: Manipulated size parameter could cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access
